query: Derek starts at the point $(0,0)$, facing the point $(0,1)$, and he wants to get to the point $(1,1)$. He takes unit steps parallel to the coordinate axes. A move consists of either a step forward, or a $90^{\circ}$ right (clockwise) turn followed by a step forward, so that his path does not contain any left turns. His path is restricted to the square region defined by $0 \leq x \leq 17$ and $0 \leq y \leq 17$. Compute the number of ways he can get to $(1,1)$ without returning to any previously visited point.
